data.title: Delicious!
data.text: I visited Gravy today for a birthday party. It was wonderful! The staff was excellent and the food was delicious! We had the risotto balls to start. I ate lasagna. It was the best! We also ordered chicken parmesan and eggplant parmesan and spaghetti and meatballs. All of the food was phenomenal!! No complaints from the 8 of us. Dessert was wonderful as well! Definitely a must if u are craving Italian!

data.title: Great food with a smile
data.text: For my birthday my girlfriend and I ate here the food was excellent but, what really made the night was our server Lewis with a w was amazing! Definitely next time we're in Raleigh we will come back and have some great italian food.

data.title: Italian goodness.
data.text: Very Surprised, Great Service from super friendly staff.  They also have plenty of space for private parties.

data.title: Anniversary Yummyness
data.text:
Yes,Yes, Yes. Gravy is amazing! We were a few minutes late because we couldn't find parking, but I had made a reservation and sooo happy I did. They were full and people were still coming looking for a table or putting there name in. I started with risotto balls and they were great. The sauce that they sit on is a perfect complement to the tastes of the risotto. I had a Raspberry Limoncello Martini. It was delicious! If they ever decide to bottle and sell their house made limoncello I will ask to have it shipped to me! It made the martini so fresh and perfectly blended. My husband had a Perroni, he wasn't to pleased because it was a bit skunked but that happens with Imported beers. 
For Dinner I had the Gnocchi with 2 types of local mushrooms, truffle oil and a delicious cream sauce. My husband had the chicken parm. My husband ate most of it but saved some so he could have more later at our hotel. I also ate most of my gnocchi, very rich and I also brought some back. We then ordered 2 more martinis and toasted to our 9yr anniversary! We were chatting and I was really enjoying my martini and our very lovely waitress brought over 2 desserts and said happy anniversary, it's on me. I thought that was a very nice gesture but unfortunately so wasted on my husband and I. I have a bit of a lactose issue and my husband doesn't really eat dessert. We both had a small amount of each. I would have eaten both if I wasn't planning on going out after dinner. Amazing, the cream was so light and airy. I can't remember what they were but I did include pictures! Must try and if you live here I think you'd become a regular... I know I would.

data.title: Good Meal
data.text: My son and I visited Gravy on a Friday night and got right in. The service was good so was the food. He got spaghetti and meatballs and it was deeelish. I would not rate it as good as a NY Italian eatery, but definitely a must try for a southern Italian eatery. My favorite part was the endless garlic rolls and the Tiramisu was outstanding. The price point was super fair. We both had a meal (His a kid meal, definitely not enough for my 10 year old) I  had a cocktail and we each had a dessert all under $50.00...I did think the menu could have more options, but they do only use local produce within 40 miles of raleigh so everything tasted pretty fresh. Definitely would go again.

data.title: Company Lunch
data.text: Our department settled on this restaurant for lunch. I have to say... the place was great. Due to our group size that they had to limit what you could pick from their menu. Fine me with, because the food was great. Thank you for a great experience.

data.title: Birthday Wishes....
data.text:
First off, I'm an Italian from New York....so my standards are pretty high for quality Italian food.  The ambiance is charming, and love the brick work. Seating is tight, but the booths are preferred.  The staff are knowledgeable and courteous. The bar is very inviting, and always hopping!
The food is very good! I've gone a number of times, and have always left with a bag to go, my belly full & happy to walk to our next adventure through Raleigh.  Bravo Gravy! 
Bon Appétit

data.title: Fantastic
data.text: We eat here occasionally when visiting our daughter at NCSU and it's always fantastic. If you like Italian food you don't want to miss this place.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: Always a positive experience here. Food and service are excellent, this time was there for restaurant week and they handled the crowd beautifully. Chicken parm was a ok but everything else we've had there is great

data.title: Delicious! Looking forward to my next visit!
data.text: Just a short walk from our son's apartment we found many interesting dining options. We happily chose Gravy. It serves Italian/ American fare. I would recommend reservations on weekends. We ordered two starters- the ricotta rice balls and the bruschetta. I highly recommend both!!! Delicious!!!! I also loved the goat cheese and spinach ravioli with fresh cherry tomatoes. They make their own pasta and limoncello! To top off the yummy dinner we shared a wonderful dessert called Budino - which is layered chocolate, vanilla custard, sea salt and almond brown sugar whip! Divine!!!! Service was excellent. The only thing that needs improvement would be the acoustics.

data.title: Very Good!!
data.text: We started with the meatball appetizer. They were pork and shrimp...you must try them. My son got the lasagna. It was the best lasagna I have ever tasted. My chicken parmesan was very good. The waitress was very attentive and pleasant. I will visit again

data.title: Bring on the meatballs!
data.text: I grew up in an Italian neighborhood and "spaghetti sauce" was always referred to as gravy. The name alone attracted me to give it a try. We ordered traditional favorites. My friends and I loved our entrees. The service was acceptable considering how busy they were. It is a bit trendy and higher priced than it should be, but the food is great.

data.title: Birthday Dinner
data.text: We went here during restaurant week special for the first time. The eggplant pie will remind you of your grandma's. Service was excellent and the atmosphere was inviting. We will be back

data.title: No good at all
data.text: Went for a Sunday night dinner. Party of four, we were served by a very uneducated waiter, rushing us since the very moment we sat at the table. He was more interesting in pushing us to drink ice water than in bringing to the table the sparkling water, removing plates from people still eating, etc etc. Thats not all (sadly) the food  is not good at all, blend, boring, no condiments whatsoever. I only ate my chicken parmigiana because after all it's fried chicken and we all love fried chicken... Not a place to return at least for a good time till they train their staff better and PLEASE GET NEW CHEFS

data.title: Saturday lunch find!
data.text: Long waiting lines pushed us along, we came upon this small local Italian place,  great discovery, highly recommend. Food, prices, service excellent!

data.title: Delicious food great service
data.text: We stopped in for a couple beers and a few appetizers. The waiter was really knowledge and friendly. We had the risotto balls and the shrimp pork balls. Both were delicious. The risotto balls were crispy, not greasy, and right portion of crispy to soft cheesy interior. The shrimp meatballs were moist and the sauce they were in was so tasty. Would definitely go back.

data.title: Good couples night
data.text: Ate here several years ago and it left an impression, so when we were back in Raleigh we decided to come back and see if it was still the same quality. Impressed once again, we got the lasagna and the bolognese. Lasagna was amazing , will go back on our next trip to Raleigh. Alexx was a great server as well

data.title: Graduation Celebration
data.text:
I enjoy Italian food immensely. It was a surprise to me to see an eatery called Gravy in Raleigh NC. Somehow, an image of biscuits slathered in (sausage) gravy came to mind, yet here it was under Italian Food listing? Anyone that knows the South Philly term for pasta sauce, is gravy, has got to be worth a try.
A totally enjoyable meal, appetizers, main course, desert, wine and coffees. Great bread, fantastic pasta and of course, the gravy! Were I not immediately flying back home, I would have taken a gallon of this gravy of the Gods with me!

You don't check this place out, your loss!

data.title: Great Place for Private Party
data.text: Last weekend attended a wedding celebration in back of Gravy Restaurant. Who would have ever known that there was such a delightful place for a celebration/private party. Service was great, and the crowd had a wonderful time celebrating.

data.title: Tasty food and good wine
data.text: As vegetarians it is often difficult to find a restaurant with more than one option that isn't an appetizer or salad.  Gravy was very accommodating.  The risotto balls with cheese inside and dipping sauce were delicious.  Then we had some spaghetti and some eggplant lasagne.  All very good but the exact same marina sauce was used for all three, as if they only know how to make one sauce.  The wine choices were good and the service was excellent.
